Tizen: Linux Foundation, Tizen Association, Samsung, Intel
Sailfish OS: Sailfish Alliance, Mer, Jolla and Sailfish community contributors
Ubuntu Touch: UBports and Ubuntu community contributors (previously Canonical Ltd.)

Android: Base system is Free and open-source, but usually bundled with proprietary apps and drivers, which provide an increasing amount of the functionality.[8]
Tizen: Partial; both proprietary and open-source components, assorted licenses
Sailfish OS: Free and open-source, but the UI and the SDK are proprietary and closed source
Ubuntu Touch: Free and open-source, mainly the GPL[9]
Plasma Mobile: Free and open-source, mainly the GPL
PureOS: Free and open-source, mainly the GPL
KaiOS: Proprietary except for open source kernel patches (formerly the MPL 2.0 B2G OS)

Tizen: Linux (based on Combination of Linux MeeGo and Samsung Bada)
KaiOS: Firefox OS / Open Web (based on Linux kernel)

Android: ARM (32-bit ARMv7-A and 64-bit ARMv8-A only), x86, x86-64[10]

Ubuntu Touch: Apps: HTML5, QML, Go, JavaScript, C++ System: C, C++, QML
PostmarketOS: Python install tool and shell script packages

Android: No[21] since Android 4.1[22] and Android 4.3[23] and more restrictions on Android 4.4[24]
Partial system updates since Oreo[25] 3rd party software like LineageOS[26]
PostmarketOS: Yes.[29] Intended for use on old mobile devices
KaiOS: For feature phones, not smart phones
